comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Sen. James K. Vardaman of Mississippi, (1861-1930)served one term in the Senate (1913-19), was somewhat controversial for his stands (!) (pro-racism against US in WW1). Click Vardaman tag to see other photos of him (always with his black hat). en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_K._Vardaman Sen. James Thomas Heflin (1869–1951), nicknamed "Cotton Tom," was a United States Senator from Alabama. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Thomas_Heflin Ollie Murray James (1871–1918), a Democrat, represented Kentucky in the United States House of Representatives and the United States Senate.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This photograph was almost certainly ttaken at the 1912 Democratic National Convention. See what I think is an associated photograph here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3239319120/ Note that Ollie James was the convention chairman and that the three men in the photograph are wearing convention delegate badges.
